@zyle1992 wrote:

Looks pretty good. Some of the code can be simplified, but overall it’s nice.

Also, I would use something other than MD5, as it’s been proven to be insecure. I would suggest using SHA-256, and add a random salt to the hash algorithm (256-bits is what I usually use), and storing the hashed password and salt in the database. You could also do the same thing with MD5, which would make it a bit harder to reverse.

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `users` (

<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

Save this one as login.php
Make sure you replace the dbhost, username, pass and database!
What this basicly do is it checks if the user is registerd in the database, and if the password and username are the same. If they are it will create a session and you’re logged in then.

If the username and password are incorrect it will ‘die’.

  <?php
 /*

 */

 $username = $_POST['username'];

 if($username&&$password)
 {

mysql_select_db($dbname);

{
//code to login
while ($row = mysql_fetch_assoc($query)) {
		$dbusername = $row['username'];
		$dbpassword = $row['password'];

if ($username==$dbusername&&$password==$dbpassword) {
echo "Succesfully logged in click <a href='member.php'>here</a> to enter the member page";
$_SESSION['username']=$username;
$_SESSION['rights']=$dbrights;


} else
echo "Incorrect password";

}
else
die("User do not exist");

} else
 
 die("Please enter a username and password!");
 
 
 ?>

basicly it will just destroy the current session.

<?php

session_destroy();//Closing the session

?>

This will create your connection to your website

Now you want to save the user’s information in your mysql database

add this method aswell to your mysqlmanager class

		public static boolean saveUserInfo(Client c){

		sqlEx.printStackTrace();
	}
	return true;
	}

	public synchronized static void destroyConnection() {
		try {
			statement.close();
			conn.close();

		}
	}

	catch (Exception sqlEx) {
		sqlEx.printStackTrace();
	}
	return true;
	}

also add this method to your mysqlmanager class:

	public synchronized static void destroyConnection() {
		try {
			statement.close();
			conn.close();
		} catch (Exception e) {
			//e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

Now your user information will be saved to your database!
you can simple add a command something like this:

					if (playerCommand.startsWith("register")) {
					MysqlManager.createUserInfoConnection();
					MysqlManager.saveUserInfo(c);
					MysqlManager.destroyConnection();
					}

Now it should create a connection to your website and save the user information!
